name: Best Western Ambra Palace Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Central location is the best feature of the hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. However, I thought the room was poor for the price and it either did not state or I failed to notice the lack of a bath, only a shower in our rooom. At this price I expected more and have stayed in other capital cities for this price and experienced far superior facilities.
reviews.title: Not really worth the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Elegent Hotel with helpful staff.Breakfast was included and ok for a european hotel.
reviews.title: Elegent Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After our less-than-stellar experience as "first class" (yeah, right, sure) passengers on the night train from Paris to Rome, this hotel came as a huge surprise. The room was gorgeous and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Friendly and Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, it's in a rundown part of town and there are lots of people living there who do not appear to be Italian. On the other hand, the front desk could get us a taxi almost immediately, and there were a number of really fine restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Nice place, Bed not so comfortable.

reviews.text: They don't have a dining room per-se', but they have a great free breakfast buffet, and they'll happily sell you sandwiches and other things later in the day (although it's a little slow since the bar mad does the cooking).
reviews.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL - LOUSY DINNERS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled as a couple, along with an other couple, so this is in a way our commen thoughts.
reviews.title: If you get a good price, book this hotel

reviews.text: The location is close to the train station and very close to a metro stop that will take you into the city center (for tourists that is The Spanish Stairs..) Location no problem. Area good, not as "nice" as other streets we saw in Rome, but absolutely not scary or trashy.
reviews.title: Do not recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good services&price

reviews.text: Our rooms were of a good size, the decor a bit outdated (if you care about that) and as we travelled as two couples one room had a functioning air-condition, the other one didn't. (but we couldn't be bothered changing rooms). Breakfast was standard.
reviews.title: One of the Best Places to Stay
A good choice
reviews.text: We got such a good price, so totally worth the stay.I would maybe upgrade the next time I go, but that's just me. Rome is amazing!

I used the Best Western Ambra Palace Hotel as my home base when visiting Rome and couldn't have made a better choice! As a woman traveling by herself, this is a bold statement for me to make. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more informative, the room was clean and perfect for my needs, and the food was amazing! If you are looking for a boutique-type of hotel for your stay in Rome, this is it!
reviews.title: I LOVED staying here!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room cosy with a large bed and well equipped, although the carpet could do with being replaced and the wallpaper above the tv area was thick with dust, never sorted out how to work the air con.
reviews.title: Hotel good but the surrounding area lets it down

reviews.text: Bathroom had a very small shower cubicle with doors which had to be opened in a particular way so as they would not fall off.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast choice good, although I have never had peas for breakfast before.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were efficient, polite, welcoming and very friendly.
reviews.title: Our best experience by far on our trip through Italy

reviews.text: This little art-deco hotel is a gem. It was very clean and the bath towels were fluffy and huge! The staff were very helpful and friendly. They arranged for tours for us as well as a car to the airport. Their recommendations for restaurants were perfect for us.
reviews.title: Family Vacation
Are you kidding!
reviews.text: There is a fresh food market across the street. It is a 2 minute walk from the metro station and some good shopping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn't go out in the neighbourhood after dark or let my teenage daughter wander about alone at any time.
reviews.title: disgusting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After traveling by car from Siena to the Rome airport to drop off our rental car and taking a taxi to the hotel arriving around 9:30pm, they tell us that we don't have a reservation. I had my written confirmation showing them that the room was paid for for two nights. Sorry, we are full and cannot take you. Finally, they admitted that it was their mistake (not right away, after we said we were calling the travel agent). They then found us another hotel nearby and paid for our taxi ride there. Which is what I would expect, but did not expect to be w/out a hotel room that was paid for over two months in advance. Very unhappy traveler.
reviews.title: ambra palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was smelly and dingy, but for the price it was what to be expected. The main problem is the neighborhood. It is near the main train station and low life degenerates were everywhere. I felt them sizing me up to see if they can mug me or take advantage of me. I am from a rough neighborhood in the South Bronx, NY so I don't scare easily, but I must admit I was a little nervous walking through this area.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near Termini Station

description: The Best Western Ambra Palace Hotel is a prestigious 4 star hotel, result of a complete renovation of an elegant building dating back to 1850; it is located in the Esquilino neighborhood, a few steps from the main train station (Roma Termini), San Giovanni in Laterano Cathedral, Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica, Opera Theatre and Vittorio Emanuele subway stop. Colosseum and Spanish Steps are only few minutes by subway from the hotel.
